intro: Exothostemon sericeus, commonly known as the silky exothostemon, is a flowering plant native to certain regions of Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes many ornamental and medicinal plants. The plant is characterized by its soft, silvery foliage, which gives it its common name. It produces small, clustered flowers that are typically white or pale yellow. Due to its unique appearance and potential horticultural value, it is occasionally cultivated in botanical gardens and by plant enthusiasts.
